articles.description: Dr. Irene Butter writes that what she saw as a child growing up in Nazi-occupied Europe bears an alarming resemblance to the threats facing American democracy today.
articles.content: Dr. Irene Butter is a Holocaust survivor. She came to the United States in 1945. Since the late 1980s, Dr. Butter has been teaching students about the Holocaust. Her memoir, "Shores Beyond Shores," d… [+6088 chars]

articles.title: Kremlin tries to blame US for massive Russian protests
articles.description: Across Russia, protesters turned out in the tens of thousands in scenes not seen in years. They were spurred in part by the arrest of newly returned opposition leader Alexey Navalny, while the Kremlin has tried to deflect blame to the US.

articles.author: Clare Duffy, CNN Business
articles.title: Microsoft beats revenue expectations as pandemic continues to fuel sales
articles.description: Microsoft exceeded Wall Street analysts' expectations for quarterly revenue by nearly $3 billion, it reported Tuesday.

articles.author: Lindsay Tigar
articles.title: The best fitness tracker of 2021
articles.description: We tested seven highly rated, beloved fitness trackers, including options from Fitbit, Garmin and more. After a more-active-than-usual couple of weeks, we found one fitness tracker that tops them all.

articles.author: Kerry Flynn, CNN Business
articles.title: CBS suspends two top execs after LA Times report alleging racism and misogyny
articles.description: CBS has suspended two of its top TV executives following a Los Angeles Times investigation that alleged they cultivated a toxic work culture involving racist and misogynistic behavior.

articles.author: Danielle Wiener-Bronner, CNN Business
articles.title: Pepsi and Beyond Meat are teaming up on plant-based snacks
articles.description: Beyond Meat and PepsiCo are combining forces to develop and distribute snacks and drinks made with plant-based protein as the plant-based trend gains even more traction.

articles.title: CNN breaks down McConnell's telling vote
articles.description: Sen. Mitch McConnell (R-KY) voted for a motion saying former President Trump's impeachment trial was unconstitutional because he is no longer in office. CNN's Ryan Nobles reports.

articles.author: Em Steck And Andrew Kaczynski
articles.title: Marjorie Taylor Greene indicated support for executing prominent Democrats in 2018 and 2019 before running for Congress
articles.description: Republican Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene repeatedly indicated support for executing prominent Democratic politicians in 2018 and 2019 before being elected to Congress, a CNN KFile review of hundreds of posts and comments from Greene's Facebook page shows.

articles.title: Elliot Page and Emma Portner say they are divorcing
articles.description: The couple announced the decision in a statement to CNN on Tuesday..

articles.title: Republicans and Democrats see promise and uncertainty in Ohio's open Senate race

articles.title: Republican extremists could doom party to endless defeats
articles.description: Douglas Heye writes that if the Republican Party continues down the road of tribalism, mistaking Trumpian tactics and controversy for long-term strategic growth, they risk further electoral and policy losses.

articles.author: Maria Santana and Chris Isidore, CNN Business
articles.title: Goya board silences its CEO after he tells Fox News the election was rigged
articles.description: Goya's board of directors had enough of CEO Robert Unanue's public comments in support of former President Donald Trump and his unfounded claims of voter fraud. On Friday, it voted to muzzle him.

articles.title: Northeast cities finally seeing a chance of snow after a near snowless January so far

articles.author: Tami Luhby and Gregory Krieg, CNN
articles.title: Democrats introduce bill to raise minimum wage to $15 by 2025
articles.description: Seeking to fulfill a long-standing Democratic ambition, a coalition of lawmakers introduced a bill on Tuesday that would raise the national minimum wage to $15 an hour.
